progression_balancing.description:
A system that can move progression earlier, to try and prevent the player from getting stuck and bored early.
A lower setting means more getting stuck. A higher setting means less getting stuck.

accessibility.description:
Set rules for reachability of your items/locations.
Locations: ensure everything can be reached and acquired.
Items: ensure all logically relevant items can be acquired.
Minimal: ensure what is needed to reach your goal can be acquired.

priority_locations.description: Prevent these locations from having an unimportant item

starting_gender.description: Determines the gender of your initial 'Sir Lee' character.

starting_class.description: Determines the starting class of your initial 'Sir Lee' character.

available_classes.description:
List of classes that will be in the item pool to find. The upgraded form of the class will be added with it.
The upgraded form of your starting class will be available regardless.

new_game_plus.description:
Puts the castle in new game plus mode which vastly increases enemy level, but increases gold gain by 50%. Not
recommended for those inexperienced to Rogue Legacy!

fairy_chests_per_zone.description:
Determines the number of Fairy Chests in a given zone that contain items. After these have been checked, only stat
bonuses can be found in Fairy Chests.

chests_per_zone.description:
Determines the number of Non-Fairy Chests in a given zone that contain items. After these have been checked, only
gold or stat bonuses can be found in Chests.

universal_fairy_chests.description: Determines if fairy chests should be combined into one pool instead of per zone, similar to Risk of Rain 2.

universal_chests.description: Determines if non-fairy chests should be combined into one pool instead of per zone, similar to Risk of Rain 2.

vendors.description: Determines where to place the Blacksmith and Enchantress unlocks in logic (or start with them unlocked).

architect.description: Determines where the Architect sits in the item pool.

architect_fee.description:
Determines how large of a percentage the architect takes from the player when utilizing his services. 100 means he
takes all your gold. 0 means his services are free.

disable_charon.description: Prevents Charon from taking your money when you re-enter the castle. Also removes Haggling from the Item Pool.

require_purchasing.description:
Determines where you will be required to purchase equipment and runes from the Blacksmith and Enchantress before
equipping them. If you disable require purchasing, Manor Renovations are scaled to take this into account.

progressive_blueprints.description:
Instead of shuffling blueprints randomly into the pool, blueprint unlocks are progressively unlocked. You would get
Squire first, then Knight, etc., until finally Dark.

gold_gain_multiplier.description: Adjusts the multiplier for gaining gold from all sources.

number_of_children.description: Determines the number of offspring you can choose from on the lineage screen after a death.

free_diary_on_generation.description: Allows the player to get a free diary check every time they regenerate the castle in the starting room.

khidr.description: Determines if Neo Khidr replaces Khidr in their boss room.

alexander.description: Determines if Alexander the IV replaces Alexander in their boss room.

leon.description: Determines if Ponce de Freon replaces Ponce de Leon in their boss room.

herodotus.description: Determines if Astrodotus replaces Herodotus in their boss room.

health_pool.description: Determines the number of Health Ups in the item pool.

mana_pool.description: Determines the number of Mana Ups in the item pool.

attack_pool.description: Determines the number of Attack Ups in the item pool.

magic_damage_pool.description: Determines the number of Magic Damage Ups in the item pool.

armor_pool.description: Determines the number of Armor Ups in the item pool.

equip_pool.description: Determines the number of Equip Ups in the item pool.

crit_chance_pool.description: Determines the number of Crit Chance Ups in the item pool.

crit_damage_pool.description: Determines the number of Crit Damage Ups in the item pool.

allow_default_names.description:
Determines if the default names defined in the vanilla game are allowed to be used. Warning: Your world will not
generate if the number of Additional Names defined is less than the Number of Children value.

death_link.description: When you die, everyone dies. Of course the reverse is true too.
